blocks.name: getCurrentUserId

blocks.comment: Get the current user ID to look up whether they have the TenantAdmin role

blocks.name: searchUsers
blocks.comment: Uses a filter on users to return the current user only if TenantAdmin is assigned

inputs.value: id eq "{ $.getCurrentUserId }" AND ((assignedRoles.name eq "TenantAdmin") or (assignedGroupsAssignedRoles.name eq "TenantAdmin"))

blocks.comment: Stop the installer as the user will need to log out and log back in for the change to propagate.

form.label: Should this installer allocate a Professional entitlement to the executing user now?
form.helpText: The executing user ({$.searchUsers[0].name}) does not have a "Professional" license entitlement assigned to them, which is one of the prerequisites of this installer. Note that the installer will still stop after this step as it is required that the user log out and log back in for the entitlement change to propagate.

inputs.value: We've updated your roles in the space: { $.lookupItemInList.name }

### Last Steps for you:
We need your help for the last steps. You need to synchronize the button with the automation to get the right Execution Token. 

#### Step 1:
Open [ODAG Selection App](https://bitmetric-bv.eu.qlikcloud.com/sense/app/{$.oSettings.ODAG-Selection-app}) *Tip: Press CTRL to open in new tab

#### Step 2: 
Edit the master-item: **Reload button** and link this to the new automation: **ODAG App Reload**.

#### Step 3: 
Setup **ODAG connection**. To explain

#### Step 4:
Start enjoying your QVD Cloud Viewer! ‚òÄ

Regards,

You're friends from Bitmetric!

blocks.name: listDataConnections

blocks.displayName: Filter over Qlik Cloud Services - List Data Connections - Filter List 3

blocks.name: inputs3
blocks.comment: Should the Developer role be auto-applied?

form.label: Should this installer add the Developer role to the executing user now?
form.helpText: The executing user ({$.searchUsers[0].name}) does not have the Developer role assigned, which is one of the prerequisites for the installers applications. This role is required to proceed as API keys are required for the data connection, and in order to create an API key, the Developer role is required. If 'No' is selected, this step will need to be done manually and the installer will exit. Note that the installer will still stop after this step regardless as it is required that the user log out and log back in for the role change to propagate in Qlik Application Automation.

blocks.name: condition2
blocks.comment: Should the Developer role be auto-applied?

conditions.input1: {$.inputs3.'Should this installer add the Developer role to the executing user now?'}

blocks.comment: Loop over each existing user role to build payload.

form.label: Should this installer enable API keys on this tenant now?
form.helpText: API keys are not currently enabled on this tenant, which is a prerequisite of the installer. An API key is required to create the data connection to Qlik Cloud that the apps leverage. If 'No' is selected, this will need to be done manually, and the installer will exit.

conditions.input1: {$.inputs10.'Should this installer enable API keys on this tenant now?'}

form.label: What should the maximum API key expiration be set to in days?
form.helpText: Note that the API key will need to be rotated for the data connection that the monitoring applications use within the timeframe that is set. This can be an automated process, but will need to be run within the window set above.

operations.name: Set value of { variable }

inputs.value: No more API keys can be generated for the executing user, as they have reached the maximum API keys designated per user as designated by this tenant's settings ({$.rawAPIRequest.max_keys_per_user}). This limit must be either increased, or API keys need to be deleted to make room for the new API key. This installer may be re-run afterwards. Exiting the installer...
